titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. James R. Whereas we are informed that several private persons, by forestalling the markets and other undue ways, have of late bought great quantities of wheat and oats, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook the assignee of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King's most excellent Majesty, and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at his Majesty's printing-house on Ormonde-Key.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at our Castle of Dublin the third day of January. 1689."
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Against engrossing and forestalling wheat and oats. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
